title: Stilfs
text:
Stilfs (; ) is a "<a href="comune">comune</a>" (municipality) in the province of <a href="South%20Tyrol">South Tyrol</a> in northern <a href="Italy">Italy</a>. It is located near the northern ramp of the <a href="Stelvio%20Pass">Stelvio Pass</a>.
The municipality of Stilfs contains the "<a href="frazione">frazioni</a>" (subdivisions, mainly villages and hamlets) <a href="Sulden">Sulden</a>, <a href="Trafoi">Trafoi</a>, <a href="Gomagoi">Gomagoi</a>.
History.
Coat-of-arms.
The emblem shows an <a href="or%20%28heraldry%29">or</a> disc on <a href="sable%20%28heraldry%29">sable</a> background; inside the disc is a six leaves star of <a href="Azure%20%28heraldry%29">azure</a>, <a href="Vert%20%28heraldry%29">vert</a> and <a href="gules">gules</a> alternating. The star symbolize an ancient nightly custom in winter time. The emblem was granted in 1969.
Society.
Linguistic distribution.
According to the 2011 census, 98.46% of the population speak German and 1.54% Italian as first language.
